intro: Conyza capitata, commonly known as blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has a branching stem covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in a composite head, which is characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Conyza capitata is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas.
